intro: Psychotria leiocarpa, commonly known as the "blue hibiscus" or "blue psychotria," is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences. The plant has elliptical to ovate leaves with smooth margins and a velvety texture. Its flowers are hermaphroditic, featuring both male and female reproductive structures, and are pollinated by insects. Psychotria leiocarpa is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant in horticulture.
